alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherry and northern Sheridan Counties through 1245 PM MDT... At 1209 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking isolated thunderstorms extending from 9 miles east of White Clay to near Chadron. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Pine Ridge, Hoover Lake, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road and Mount Maria. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 99 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
